lead_paragraph: The Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt ran the second-fastest 100 meters ever, finishing in 9.76 seconds at the Jamaica International Invitational in Kingston. Bolt’s time at the National Stadium on Saturday was 0.02 off Asafa Powell’s world record. “I was definitely surprised when I saw the time,” Bolt said. “I was in shape for a 9.85.”.
